reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the national response to HIV in order to scale up prevention to comprehensive care, factoring in gender and key populations at high risk of HIV infection

description.narrative: Estimates from UNAIDS in 2008 show an average HIV prevalence of 3.9 percent in Côte d'Ivoire which makes it the most affected country in the Western Africa region. Women are disproportionately affected by the epidemic, with a prevalence of 6.4 percent compared to 2.9 percent for men. An extremely high prevalence is also noted in three key populations: Commercial Sex Workers (CSW), Men who have Sex with Men (MSM), and prisoners. The Round 9 proposal further supports the National Strategic Plan for 2006 to 2010 in achieving universal access to prevention, treatment, care and support services. The Program is implemented through the dual-track financing scheme by two Principal Recipients (PR). It aims to prevent new infections, to treat, and to provide care and support for key populations at high risk of HIV infection and for vulnerable populations through gender-specific intervention. The activities implemented by this PR focus on behavior change communication, strengthening the quality and access to Counseling and Testing (CT) services, and support to orphans and vulnerable children (OVC).

title.narrative: CIV-910-G12-H Progress Report
CIV-910-G12-H Program Agreement 1
CIV-910-G12-H Program Agreement
CIV-910-G12-H Program Agreement
CIV-910-G12-H Grant Performance Report
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 1
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 2
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 3
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 4
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 5
CIV-910-G12-H Implementation Letter 6
Coverage / Output indicator for CIV-910-G12-H
GP-other 1: Number of victims/survivors of sexual violence who received care including PEP in South Comoe region
Number of victims of sexual violence cared for in health care facilities by sex and age

TCS other 3: Number of adults and children with advanced HIV infection who are currently receiving antiretroviral therapy in accordance with the nationally approved treatment protocol at the end of the reporting period (ONLY ADULTS AS OF OCTOBER 2016)
Number of TB health facilities which offer HIV counseling and testing to TB patients
% of HIV-infected pregnant women assessed for eligibility for antiretroviral therapy (CD4 count or clinical staging)
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of health facilities dispensing antiretroviral therapy that experienced a stock-out of at least one required antiretroviral drug in the last 12 month

TCS-other 2: Number of adults and children in Sud Comoé with advanced HIV infection who are currently receiving antiretroviral therapy in accordance with the nationally approved treatment protocol at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Number of health workers trained in prevention (PMTCT)
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
PMTCT-2: Number of HIV-infected pregnant women who received antiretroviral drugs to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission

TCS-other 4: Number of children with advanced HIV infection who are currently receiving antiretroviral therapy in accordance with the nationally approved treatment protocol at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
GP-other 2: Number of cases of sexually transmitted infections correctly diagnosed, treated and counseled in the health facilities (by age and sex)
KP-other 2: Number of prisoners having benefitted from peer education BCC prevention messages
Percentage of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Impact indicator for CIV-910-G12-H
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of people who inject drugs who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for CIV-910-G12-H
Current school attendance among orphans and non-orphans
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
% of men reporting the use of condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner in the last 6 months
HIV O-Other 1: Percentage of female and male sex workers reporting the use of a condom during penetrative sex with their most recent client
HIV O-Other 1: % of young women and men aged 15–24 who both correctly identify ways of preventing the sexual transmission of HIV and who reject the major misconceptions about HIV transmission
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who have had sexual intercourse with more than one partner in the past 12 months
